availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Drucilla J. Staton Johnston on November 14, 1841. Father of Nancy M. Johnston, Joseph O. Johnston, Mary Johnston, Elizab Johnston, Isaac Johnston, Phelix F. Johnston, Bell A. Johnston, and Jennie Johnston. Farmer in Marshall County in 1850. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County. p. 480A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, p. 122.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Staton District, p. 16.
“Meeting in Marshall County,” Louisville Daily Courier, (Louisville, Ky.), July 10, 1861, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "James H. Johnston (1822-1899)," Memorial #64546616, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64546616# (accessed August 20, 2018).
